pathogen.pathogenesis: B. burgdorferi is deposited in skin lesions left by Ixodes ticks, and can then invade the bloodstream leading to dissemination throughout the body and cause problems in joints and nervous tissues (Salyers and Whitt., 2002).
pathogen.protective_immunity: In most people B. burgdorferi is cleared from the bloodstream via antibodies and phagocytic cells (Salyers and Whitt., 2002).
pathogen.host_range: White footed mouse are the reservoir of B. burgdorferi. The bacteria are carried by ticks which vector the bacteria to other hosts such as humans, as well as small mammals such as voles and shrews. Animal models include rabbits, mice and dogs (Salyers and Whitt., 2002).
pathogen.introduction: Borrelia burgdorferi is a species of Gram negative bacteria of the spirochete class of the genus Borrelia. B. burgdorferi is predominant in North America, but also exists in Europe, and is the agent of Lyme disease. It is a zoonotic, vector-borne disease transmitted by ticks and is named after the researcher Willy Burgdorfer who first isolated the bacterium in 1982. B. burgdorferi is one of the few pathogenic bacteria that can survive without iron, having replaced all of its iron-sulfur cluster enzymes with enzymes that use manganese, thus avoiding the problem many pathogenic bacteria face in acquiring iron (Wiki: B. burgdorferi).

vaccine.vaccine_name: B. burgdorferi DbpA and OspA Protein Vaccine

host_response.vaccination_protocol: Mice were immunized by intraperitoneal injection of 10 μg of DbpAN40, 10 μg of OspAN40, 5 μg of DbpAN40 plus 5 μg of OspAN40, or 2.5 μg of E. coli protein extract with complete Freund's adjuvant and then, 4 weeks later, were given a second immunization of protein in incomplete Freund's adjuvant (Hanson et al., 2000).
host_response.protection_efficacy: All mice immunized with the combined DbpAN40-OspAN40 vaccine (5 μg of each antigen) were protected against even the highest challenge dose of 10^6 spirochetes (Hanson et al., 2000).
host_response.challenge_protocol: At week 6, five of the mice in each immunization group were challenged by subcutaneous injection, into the dorsolateral thorax, of cloned B. burgdorferi N40 (Hanson et al., 2000).

vaccine.antigen: The recombinant fusion lipoprotein pp2:DbpAN40(His)6 (DbpAN40) (Hanson et al., 2000).

host_response.vaccination_protocol: Mice were immunized by intraperitoneal injection of 10 μg of DbpAN40, 10 μg of OspAN40, 5 μg of DbpAN40 plus 5 μg of OspAN40, or 2.5 μg of E. coli protein extract with complete Freund's adjuvant and then, 4 weeks later, were given a second immunization of protein in incomplete Freund's adjuvant (Hanson et al., 2000).
host_response.protection_efficacy: Mice immunized with recombinant DbpA protein are protected against challenge with Borrelia burgdorferi. Nearly all mice immunized with 10 μg of DbpAN40 were protected from challenge with 10^3 or 10^4 spirochetes (Hanson et al., 2000).
host_response.challenge_protocol: At week 6, five of the mice in each immunization group were challenged by subcutaneous injection, into the dorsolateral thorax, of cloned B. burgdorferi N40 (Hanson et al., 2000).

vaccine.vaccine_name: B. burgdorferi DNA vaccine encoding strain B31 OspA

host_response.immune_response: Sera from mice immunized with the ospA-bearing plasmid DNA had high levels of antibody that recognized both native and rOspA lipoprotein (Luke et al., 1997).
host_response.vaccination_protocol: Female C3H/HeN mice (6-10 weeks old) were injected with plasmid diluted in sterile 0.9% saline. Each mouse received intramuscular injections into left and right rectus femoris muscles with 50 J-lg of plasmid in 50 J-lL of saline. For immunization with protein, mice were injected in the back with purified B31 rOspA lipoprotein (Luke et al., 1997).
host_response.protection_efficacy: Immunization with VR2210 protected 100% of mice against infection with Sh-2-82 or N40, 2 infectious strains of B. burgdorferi (Luke et al., 1997).
host_response.challenge_protocol: Mice were challenged intradermally by injecting 100 x ID50 of the infectious isolate at the base of the tail (Luke et al., 1997).

vaccine.vaccine_name: B. burgdorferi DNA vaccine pCMV-ZS7/TPA encoding OspC from Borrelia burgdorferi sensu lato

host_response.immune_response: Both i.d. injection and gene-gun application of plasmid DNA encoding the ospC gene induced a reliable humoral response with high antibody titers, antigen-specific cellular responses and, most importantly, provided effective protection (Scheiblhofer et al., 2003).
host_response.protection_efficacy: The protection rate after challenge with 10 B. burgdorferi organisms per mouse was between 80% and 100% for all groups. These results demonstrate that a DNA vaccine encoding OspC of B. burgdorferi is suitable for inducing protection against Lyme borreliosis (Scheiblhofer et al., 2003).
host_response.challenge_protocol: Control groups received challenge doses B. burgdorferi strain ZS7 of 10^4, 10^3, 10^2, and 10 live spirochetes per animal (Scheiblhofer et al., 2003).

host_response.vaccination_protocol: Four-week-old female mice were primed intraperitoneally with 20 μg of each immunogen in 200 μL of complete Freund's adjuvant. Three boosts containing the same amount of immunogen in incomplete Freund's adjuvant were administered at 2, 5, and 8 weeks following the initial injection (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).
host_response.protection_efficacy: Mice immunized with recombinant OspA protein were protected from challenge with Borrelia burgdorferi (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).
host_response.challenge_protocol: Ten days following the final boost, mice received a subcutaneous inoculation containing 10^7 SON 188 organisms in 100 μl of BSK II medium (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).

host_response.vaccination_protocol: Four-week-old female mice were primed intraperitoneally with 20 μg of each immunogen in 200 μL of complete Freund's adjuvant. Three boosts containing the same amount of immunogen in incomplete Freund's adjuvant were administered at 2, 5, and 8 weeks following the initial injection (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).
host_response.protection_efficacy: Mice immunized with recombinant OspB protein were protected from challenge with Borrelia burgdorferi (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).
host_response.challenge_protocol: Ten days following the final boost, mice received a subcutaneous inoculation containing 107 SON 188 organisms in 100 μl of BSK II medium (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).

host_response.vaccination_protocol: Four-week-old female mice were primed intraperitoneally with 20 μg of each immunogen in 200 μL of complete Freund's adjuvant. Three boosts containing the same amount of immunogen in incomplete Freund's adjuvant were administered at 2, 5, and 8 weeks following the initial injection (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).
host_response.protection_efficacy: Mice immunized with recombinant OspC protein were protected from challenge with Borrelia burgdorferi (Hanson et al., 1998).
host_response.challenge_protocol: Ten days following the final boost, mice received a subcutaneous inoculation containing 107 SON 188 organisms in 100 μl of BSK II medium (Probert and LeFebvre, 1994).

gene_engineering.description: This fla mutant is from Borrelia burgdorferi (Sadziene et al., 1996).

host_response.persistence: A fla mutant is attenuated in SCID mice (Sadziene et al., 1996).
host_response.protection_efficacy: A fla mutant induces protection in mice from challenge with wild type B. burgdorferi 28 days after inoculation (Sadziene et al., 1996).
